alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 30 at 9:47PM PST until January 01 at 12:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Coastal Areas, Orange County Inland Areas, Riverside County Mountains, San Bernardino County Mountains, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire, San Diego County Coastal Areas, San Diego County Mountains, San Diego County Valleys and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of heavy rain associated with an Atmospheric River will move across Southern California Saturday night. The heavy rain will move into San Bernardino and Orange Counties in the evening, and then move south across Riverside and San Diego County through midnight. The rain will taper off and end toward daybreak Sunday. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Bernardino County Mountains
